document.title: South Carolina Academic Standards and Performance Indicators for Science

8383FF462BCF4BF68D3684454D250FCB.description:
Analyze and interpret data from observations to describe how changes in the
environment cause plants to respond in different ways (such as turning leaves toward the
Sun, leaves changing color, leaves wilting, or trees shedding leaves).

CB56514EFA2D4F7D89547D766CACD0CE.description:
Develop and use models to compare how the different characteristics of plants help them
survive in distinct environments (including deserts, forests, and grasslands).

7BC7EA9A14564EAEACC1FBD5C76268BF.description:
Conduct structured investigations to answer questions about what plants need to live and
grow (including air, water, sunlight, minerals, and space).

53601B35804B4123BC4677359615CDF9.description:
Plants have basic needs that provide energy in order to grow
and be healthy. Each plant has a specific environment where it can thrive. There are distinct
environments in the world that support different types of plants. These environments can change
slowly or quickly. Plants respond to these changes in different ways.

94A6D0385F9844C9AC7C9309E937FF2D.description:
Construct explanations of the stages of development of a flowering plant as it grows
from a seed using observations and measurements.

8DEA18D0EE5D4E9099327BA306C3E34B.description:
Obtain and communicate information to construct explanations for how different plant
structures (including roots, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits, and seeds) help plants survive,
grow, and produce more plants.

BDA6601074B44110B2A98FDD15737BFE.description:
Plants have specific structures that help them survive, grow,
and produce more plants. Plants have predictable characteristics at different stages of development.

78371460FD8744A494FDCF9E7883231F.description: Life Science: Plants and their Environments

BE6EA2F69FA84CCABAE6FD4742F6B197.description:
Obtain and communicate information to explain ways natural resources can be
conserved (such as reducing trash through reuse, recycling, or replanting trees).

44973EB23B73496083BCF7C34EE930A9.description:
Obtain and communicate information to summarize how natural resources are used in
different ways (such as soil and water to grow plants; rocks to make roads, walls, or
buildings; or sand to make glass).

590339CCB3CE44D8B883E2D00D60306E.description:
Natural resources are things that people use that come from
Earth (such as land, water, air, and trees). Natural resources can be conserved.

3CBC6EF60E43487298719EADDFDED23A.description:
Conduct structured investigations to answer questions about how the movement of water
can change the shape of the land.

BC363623ECD94BCAB78B99F6124E9CBC.description:
Develop and use models (such as drawings or maps) to describe patterns in the
distribution of land and water on Earth and classify bodies of water (including oceans,
rivers and streams, lakes, and ponds).

5B4890CA0E304EACB5D6041AE6519204.description:
Analyze and interpret data from observations and measurements to compare the
properties of Earth materials (including rocks, soils, sand, and water).

E8BF577CC4D84528AD504380D8271CD6.description:
Earth is made of different materials, including rocks, sand,
soil, and water. An Earth material is a resource that comes from Earth. Earth materials can be
classified by their observable properties.

0F47B90F810A4890901A634261E87C5D.description:
Define problems related to the warming effect of sunlight and design possible solutions
to reduce its impact on a particular area.

ED745080E0394948A70A303C3165AA9F.description:
Conduct structured investigations to answer questions about the effect of sunlight on
Earth’s surface.

D3B5A21BD677421A9E78FA265921CBCD.description:
Obtain and communicate information to describe how technology has enabled the study
of the Sun, the Moon, planets, and stars.

6ADBE63145FD460698223422DEC704A4.description:
Use data from personal observations to describe, predict, and develop models to
exemplify how the appearance of the moon changes over time in a predictable pattern.

76777E15BF0E4ABE9C2B8A2CD470B21F.description:
Use, analyze, and interpret data from observations to describe and predict seasonal
patterns of sunrise and sunset.

61C51FFE3282466492A544B93C583342.description:
Objects in the sky move in predictable patterns. Some objects
are better seen in the day sky and some are better seen in the night sky. The Sun is a star that
provides heat and light energy for Earth.

159DCCAEF8AB42488A1DA4ACBF2FE704.description: Earth Science: Exploring the Sun and Moon

ECF670E19025445D9832B8E7ECE7AF40.description:
Develop and use models to describe what happens when light shines on mirrors based on
observations and data collected.

2BDFAFCCE7FE49BD833953EA88D833B4.description:
Conduct structured investigations to answer questions about how shadows change when
the position of the light source changes.

2D3B706A53524EC1A4A92F7359696EF7.description:
Analyze and interpret data from observations to compare how light behaves when it
shines on different materials.

984E0709DE8745BD984B3C21CB83A2DC.description:
Obtain and communicate information to describe how light is required to make objects
visible.

02CE925E2CE74A3EAA1A2F71FF9247A7.description:
Objects can only be seen when light shines on them. Some
materials allow light to pass through them; others allow only some light to pass through; and some
do not allow any light to pass through and will create a shadow of the object. Technology such as
mirrors can change the direction of a beam of light.

5579437088DA41A5BAB5B0DA00287E64.description: Physical Science: Exploring Light and Shadows

F6F23F43F15E461789E8EF7D6B121111.description:
Construct devices or design solutions to solve specific problems or needs: (1) ask
questions to identify problems or needs, (2) ask questions about the criteria and
constraints of the devices or solutions, (3) generate and communicate ideas for possible
devices or solutions, (4) build and test devices or solutions, (5) determine if the devices
or solutions solved the problem, and (6) communicate the results.

30E2C899CD324205BEC7B6381DECA365.description:
Technology is any modification to the natural world created
to fulfill the wants and needs of humans. The engineering design process involves a series of
iterative steps used to solve a problem and often leads to the development of a new or improved
technology.

221E3AC9CA3B47A18956013DC35F8481.description:
Obtain and evaluate informational texts, observations, data collected, or discussions to
(1) generate and answer questions about the natural world, (2) understand phenomena,
(3) develop models, or (4) support explanations. Communicate observations and
explanations clearly through oral and written language

30387EB4B8B04ED78E26D81238CBDCDB.description:
Construct scientific arguments to support claims or explanations using evidence from
observations or data collected.

8C61DE1670C548A8AF429BC3E5B12CB7.description:
Construct explanations of phenomena using (1) student-generated observations and
measurements, (2) results of scientific investigations, or (3) data communicated in
graphs, tables, or diagrams.

F6D4B25E113748E4BBA1DA3E8AC18148.description:
Use mathematical and computational thinking to (1) recognize and express quantitative
observations, (2) collect and analyze data, or (3) understand patterns and relationships.

898E01DFD3BB4195B528D785F27EA50A.description:
Analyze and interpret data from observations, measurements, or investigations to
understand patterns and meanings.

C03B362AA06646E0BB213A21AEF78C92.description:
With teacher guidance, conduct structured investigations to answer scientific questions,
test predictions and develop explanations: (1) predict possible outcomes, (2) identify
materials and follow procedures, (3) use appropriate tools or instruments to collect
qualitative and quantitative data, and (4) record and represent data in an appropriate
form. Use appropriate safety procedures.

60091E519FAA4FAE8E1C455684E68B4D.description:
Develop and use models to (1) understand or represent phenomena, processes, and
relationships, (2) test devices or solutions, or (3) communicate ideas to others.

0F8BE97EFE904AA8AE754A0707BDB410.description:
Ask and answer questions about the natural world using explorations, observations, or
structured investigations.

4275A24FA3BB4FEEB7BD81E370F94EFB.description:
The practices of science and engineering support the
development of science concepts, develop the habits of mind that are necessary for scientific
thinking, and allow students to engage in science in ways that are similar to those used by scientists
and engineers.
